intro: Cyphia incisa var. lyrata, commonly known as the Lyrate Cyphia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, lyrate-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pale blue or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
